column9: My 90 yr old mother with congestive heart failure was put on this drug &  unbelieveable after 24 hrs how she was breathing again.  she has taken lasix for years and i guess onece in awhile just needs a boost.

column1: Accumulation of Fluid Resulting from Chronic Heart Failure
column2: Von, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My fluid retention immediatly became better in two weeks I was at a comfortable level ---   I have not yet determined what to do for maintenence

column2: bh2vette, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was given this medication by a physician here along with Lasix 40mg w/o potassium. I experienced horrendous depleation of potassium, muscle damage, heart irregularaties. When I addressed this with him, he simply stated well, you need to be proactive with this med.

column1: Fluid in the Lungs due to Chronic Heart Failure
column2: dakanana, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
column9: This is the first drug that has helped get rid of my fluid completely.

column1: Accumulation of Fluid Resulting from Chronic Heart Failure
column2: 75 or over Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Worked extremely well and quickly to remove extra fluids. Took extra potassium at the same time. Within 24 hours breathing was eased significantly and coughing almost stopped.

column1: Accumulation of Fluid Resulting from Chronic Heart Failure
column9: Although the drug effectively reduced the fluid retention in my legs, I had a difficult time controlling potassium and magnesium. Has resulted in muscle cramps, dizzyness and weakness. It should be noted that I was taking extra Mag.and potassium.but still had problems

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have to take this medication for fluid retention. The side effect of muscle cramping is unbearable. Arms, legs, fingers, toes neck and rib cage cramp simultaniously and so severely I fall and cannot move. The pain is excruciating.
